title: I am using machine A to set up tracking server on machine B, but mlflow.set_tracking_uri() gives following error.

labels.name: area/tracking
labels.description: Tracking service, tracking client APIs, autologging

body:
So mlflow has a function set_tracking_uri(), where we can pass http/https URL of the tracking server as an argument. However, I dont have clue from the mlflow documents of the proper steps to start the tracking server. I am using mlflow with Nvidia's odth retinanet repository ```https://github.com/NVIDIA/retinanet-examples/```

 Here are the commands I use:

  1) `In terminal 1`:  mlflow server --host 0.0.0.0
  2) `In terminal 2`:  python main.py train --args1 --args2 -- 

However, I end up getting this issue .
During handling of the above exception, another exception occurred:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "main.py", line 244, in <module>
    main()
  File "main.py", line 238, in main
    worker(0, args, 1, model, state)
  File "main.py", line 180, in worker
    regularization_l2=args.regularization_l2, rotated_bbox=args.rotated_bbox, absolute_angle=args.absolute_angle)
  File "/home/nakul/retinanet_pytorch/retinanet/train.py", line 33, in train
    with mlflow.start_run():
  File "/opt/conda/lib/python3.6/site-packages/mlflow/tracking/fluent.py", line 159, in start_run
    active_run_obj = MlflowClient().create_run(experiment_id=exp_id_for_run, tags=tags)
  File "/opt/conda/lib/python3.6/site-packages/mlflow/tracking/client.py", line 137, in create_run
    return self._tracking_client.create_run(experiment_id, start_time, tags)
  File "/opt/conda/lib/python3.6/site-packages/mlflow/tracking/_tracking_service/client.py", line 95, in create_run
    tags=[RunTag(key, value) for (key, value) in iteritems(tags)],
  File "/opt/conda/lib/python3.6/site-packages/mlflow/store/tracking/rest_store.py", line 145, in create_run
    response_proto = self._call_endpoint(CreateRun, req_body)
  File "/opt/conda/lib/python3.6/site-packages/mlflow/store/tracking/rest_store.py", line 52, in _call_endpoint
    return call_endpoint(self.get_host_creds(), endpoint, method, json_body, response_proto)
  File "/opt/conda/lib/python3.6/site-packages/mlflow/utils/rest_utils.py", line 153, in call_endpoint
    host_creds=host_creds, endpoint=endpoint, method=method, json=json_body
  File "/opt/conda/lib/python3.6/site-packages/mlflow/utils/rest_utils.py", line 78, in http_request
    max_rate_limit_interval, url=url, headers=headers, verify=verify, **kwargs
  File "/opt/conda/lib/python3.6/site-packages/mlflow/utils/rest_utils.py", line 57, in request_with_ratelimit_retries
    response = requests.request(**kwargs)
  File "/home/nakul/.local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/requests/api.py", line 61, in request
    return session.request(method=method, url=url, **kwargs)
  File "/home/nakul/.local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/requests/sessions.py", line 530, in request
    resp = self.send(prep, **send_kwargs)
  File "/home/nakul/.local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/requests/sessions.py", line 643, in send
    r = adapter.send(request, **kwargs)
  File "/home/nakul/.local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/requests/adapters.py", line 516, in send
    raise ConnectionError(e, request=request)
requests.exceptions.ConnectionError: HTTPSConnectionPool(host='10.1.20.152', port=5000): Max retries exceeded with url: /api/2.0/mlflow/runs/create (Caused by NewConnectionError('<urllib3.connection.HTTPSConnection object at 0x7f83bc22ceb8>: Failed to establish a new connection: [Errno 111] Connection refused',))


I kindly request to post step-by-step guide about
1) What modifications to make in files other than setting set_tracking_uri()
2)  what commands to use to start the tracking server

Looking forward to seeing the solution soon. Thanks
